name: Whose Mic Is It Anyway - Mixed Open Mic Event
description: Whose Mic Is It Anyway?: Open Mic NightsIt’s yours!An open mic event welcoming all musicians, comedians, poets, storytellers, and more. Whether you’re a first-timer or a seasoned performer, this open mic is for you.It will be a safe space (rather, a safe stage) for you to try out your new stand-up material, to perform a poem close to your heart, or sing that song you’re not confident about. No pressure, no judgement; just a place for you to own the spotlight and give the world your best.And for our audience: come and enjoy a fun evening with some of the cities most talented artists. (See performers? We’re already cheering for you!)This event happens every alternate week, so if you can’t make it this time, you can sign up for it next time!About the host: OninthoughOften branded as a sarcastic soul and an outright cynic, Oninthough is infamous for his observational humour and satirical comedy, often coupled with political undertones and religious overtones.Oninthough was crowned "Lord of Humour" at UNMAAD 2021, IIM-Bangalore. His humour has been lauded by the likes of internationally acclaimed comedians like Craig Shoemaker, Matt Banwart, and Raj Poojara, and renowned Indian comedian Kunal Kamra. He has also been featured by DailyHunt, DNA, Times Now, Indian Express, Aaj Tak, WhatsHOT Bangalore, The Sarcastic Indian, and many other publications.He has performed for audiences across 20+ cities, 7 countries, and 3 continents. With over 75k shares across social media, his punchlines and humour jabs are amongst the most shared comedic content.

name: Kavitayon Ki Dastak
description: Dialogues Cafe brings to you a Sunday full of kavitā and shāyari!If you love writing or just listening to Hindi poetry or couplets of shāyari or lyrical ghazals — we invite you to a poetic sundowner filled with hindi writing and sher-shāyari. Let`s get together for `Kavitāyon Ki Dastak`, an open mic — or rather an open mehfil — to set your mood and make you feel wholesome."utth ke mehfil se mat chale jānātum se raushan ye konā konā hai"Be a part of this community, share the love and lehzā with your words. Come join us to have agood time reciting, listening and absorbing the creativity of Hindi artists and shāyars. Wrap up your week with mellow vibes and be rejuvenated to start the next week afresh!Venue: Dialogues Café, KoramangalaEvery Second Sunday of the MonthTime: 5:00 pm to 7:00 pm

name: Dialogues with Books: A Mystery Awaits
description: Dialogues with Books Monthly Meetup: A Mystery AwaitsThis month, DWB is diving into the shadows for a genre-specific gathering that’s all about Mystery!Whether you're into classic whodunits, psychological thrillers, cozy mysteries, or gritty noir, we’re shining the spotlight on all things enigmatic. From iconic authors like Conan Doyle, Agatha Christie and Raymond Chandler to modern masters like Tana French, Jane Harper and Gillian Flynn- this meetup is for the curious, the clue-hunters, and the plot-twist lovers.Bring your favourite mystery book, a recommendation, or just your sleuthing spirit. Let’s crack open some secrets together. 🔎What is Dialogues with Books: DWB is one of Bangalore's much loved book communities. With a thriving online community and engaging monthly meetups/events, we have over the years carefully created a close knit group of bibliophiles and enthusiastic readers.We meet up regularly on the third Sunday of every month.Note: Rs.100 as cover is part of the ticket price.

name: The Bohra Thaal – An Authentic Bohra Cuisine
description: Have You Ever Experienced Dining in a Traditional Bohra Thaal?If not, here’s your chance to be part of an intimate and one-of-a-kind home dining experience. Hosted in the comfort of a warm, welcoming home, this gathering brings together like-minded individuals to share a meal, exchange stories, and turn strangers into friends—all while indulging in the rich flavors of Bohra cuisine.Bohra cuisine originates from the Bohra Muslim community, with roots tracing back to Yemen before flourishing in India. Over the centuries, it has evolved into a delightful fusion of Middle Eastern, Mughlai, Gujarati, and Maharashtrian flavors, reflecting a legacy of migration, trade, and cultural influences.What makes Bohra dining truly special is its communal style—meals are served in a giant "Thaal", where 4 to 6 guests dine together, fostering a deep sense of connection, warmth, and tradition.From Finance to Flavours: My Journey into Bohra CuisineAs a Chartered Accountant, I built a career in finance, working with esteemed firms like Avendus and ASK. While finance was my profession, my true passion lay in cooking.Back in Mumbai, my home-cooked meals were always a highlight among friends and colleagues. After relocating to Bengaluru six months ago, I finally decided to follow my culinary dream, giving birth to The Bohra Thaal—a heartfelt endeavor to bring the authentic Bohra "Thaal" experience to Namma Bengaluru.Now, we invite you to be part of this journey and savor a 9-course Bohra feast—served with love, straight from our home to your plate.What to Expect?🍽️ Indulge in an authentic 9-course Bohra feast🍛 Dine the traditional way—sharing a giant Thaal with 4 to 6 guests🏡 Experience the warmth of home-style communal dining⏳ Pre-booking closes 2 days in advance"The nourishment of the body is food, while the nourishment of the soul is feeding others." — Hazrat Ali

location.address: BLOCK-10, PRESTIGE NOTTING HILL, Bannerghatta Rd, Kalena Agrahara, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560076, India

name: 💌 Letters to Strangers
description: ​In a world of quick replies and seen ticks, this is a return to something slower, simpler, and more human.​Join us for a casual meetup where we’ll write handwritten letters—not to friends you already know, but to strangers across the table. Through gentle prompts, you’ll write from the heart: reflections, questions, memories, or a moment captured in ink.✨ What to Expect:​📝 Prompts, not pressure. You’ll be gently guided to write.📓 Paper, Pen & Presence. We’re keeping it analogue—no digital devices.☕ Chai & quiet company. A warm cup to keep you grounded as you write.

name: Anime Pop-Up @ Bento Bento
description: Bento Bento Presents: An Anime-Inspired Culinary Experience14th & 15th June | 12:30–3:00 PM, 7:00–10:00 PMBento Bento is back with a new celebration of food and fandom — this time diving into the vibrant and flavourful world of anime.Inspired by iconic scenes and comfort meals from some of Japan’s most beloved anime series, this curated pop-up brings to life dishes that fans have seen on screen and long wondered about. With past tributes to Studio Ghibli and Midnight Diner, Bento Bento now takes a fresh turn towards the fast-paced, heartfelt, and imaginative food culture of anime.Chef Anumitra, whose culinary roots are shaped in part by her time in Japan, brings a deep respect for authenticity while channeling the visual flair and nostalgia that these shows evoke. Whether you’re a long-time anime fan or a curious food lover, Bento Bento invites you to taste the flavours of your favourite shows.Come hungry. Leave nostalgic. THE MENUSweets & SnacksDorayaki – Doraemon Soft, fluffy pancakes filled with sweet red bean paste. This is Doraemon’s favorite snack — a simple, sweet treat with a hint of nostalgia.Dango – Naruto Chewy rice dumplings on skewers, glazed with sweet soy sauce. Often eaten during festivals, dango is a symbol of joy and camaraderie.Savoury DishesOnigiri (Single) – Demon Slayer Triangular rice balls wrapped in seaweed and filled with surprises like tangy pickled plum or seasoned vegetables — a staple in bento boxes and beloved by anime heroes on the go.Gyoza – Food Wars Pan-seared Japanese dumplings with a juicy, seasoned filling. These dumplings are ubiquitous in Food Wars' competitions, and here they’re served crisp with a dipping sauce.Nikuman – Haikyuu!! Fluffy steamed buns filled with savoury pork. This hearty snack is a popular reward after volleyball practice scenes in Haikyuu!!, and perfect for a quick burst of energy.MealsRamen – Naruto A steaming bowl of noodles in rich broth, topped with marinated egg, pork, and greens. This dish is practically a co-star in Naruto, where Ichiraku Ramen is a frequent backdrop.Katsudon – Yuri on Ice, My Hero Academia A comforting bowl of rice topped with crispy pork cutlet, soft scrambled egg, and sweet-salty sauce. Katsudon is often portrayed as a dish of encouragement and reward in anime.Chicken Karaage Bento Juicy, marinated fried chicken served with rice and pickles — this Japanese-style fried chicken bento is crunchy, satisfying, and a lunchbox favorite.Brinjal with Ponzu Bento A vegetarian bento featuring grilled or roasted brinjal dressed in a tangy ponzu sauce. Balanced, light, and packed with umami.Vegetarian variations are available upon request.

At Jugni Kitchen & Bar, we’ve created a haven for those who seek more than just a meal; it's a place where nostalgia, comfort, and vibrant energy come together.

name: Starry Nights - Art | Music | Food
description: Join us on a beautiful rooftop as the Bangalore breeze sets the mood for a chill, art-filled night. name: Leela by Sanjay Divecha (Live) at Sabha BLR
description: Sanjay Divecha is one of the most revered guitar players in India. A unique and compelling voice as a player and composer, he is part of the hugely successful supergroup Cross Currents led by Zakir Hussain and featuring stalwarts such as Dave Holland, Vinnie Colaiuta, Chris Potter, Eddie Daniels, Shankar Mahadevan and Louiz Banks. Through a luminous 35 year long career, Sanjay has worked with artists such as Angelique Kidjo, Carlos Santana, Michael McDonald, Fred Raulston, Dave Weckl, Louis Johnson, Dumazz and Sambaguru among others.He also collaborated with A.R. Rahman on the Danny Boyle movie “127 Hours” that won ‘Best Original Score’, the OST for the movie “Woman on Top” with Argentinian composer Luis Bacalov, Sanjay also scored for the movie ‘Leela’ by Somnath Sen which won a Special Jury Award at Toronto Reel World Film Festival.An alumnus (1989) from Musician’s Institute (M.I) in Los Angeles, Sanjay continues to mentor and develop musicians all over the country. His students are not only guitar players, but composers, musicians and singers of all disciplines. Sanjay teaches private lessons and holds workshops to develop musicality and a well rounded aesthetic sensibility in musicians. Sanjay Divecha on the music of 'Leela' :As a human being on this planet I’ve always believed in the Oneness of all things in this universe. Going through life's bylanes and observing how events unfold and teach you the lessons to be learned, this belief of Oneness has only strengthened with time. My work as an artist has primarily been to connect with my inner self, and express from a place of honesty. The yearning to learn something new in my art and refine my skill set has been my constant companion. After having written and performed music with various ensembles, I finally mustered up the courage to record a collection of music which was mainly written for solo guitar, and also mainly recorded on acoustic guitar. These songs are reflections of some of my journeys and inspirations, interpreted in a spontaneous and instinctive manner. The title 'Leela' refers to the divine Leela - joyous and playful - yet a profound act of creation. As I started the recording process I started to add a few layers to enhance the music and some guest artists came on board to complete the experience which was truly fulfilling for me as an artist. The organic nature of this work takes me back to my formative years as a guitar player and I’m grateful to be sharing this work and for it to take its own journey.

name: Heirlooms from the Hills
description: As our next pop-up, we bring to you Heirlooms from the Hills by chef Chef Rita Blah A nostalgic retelling of Shillong’s Culinary LandscapeMeet Rita: The Home Chef from ShillongBorn and raised in the lush hills of Shillong, Rita’s cooking tells stories of community, memory, and quiet mastery. She learnt by watching — her grandmother stirring smoky bamboo shoot stews over a wood fire, her mother marinating pork with local spices, neighbours sharing recipes through whispered tips and shared meals.For over 50 years, Rita has cooked — not for acclaim, but for love. Her kitchen has always been open to family, friends, and the lucky few who get to experience her deeply rooted, intuitively crafted dishes. Her food has travelled quietly from Shillong to Bombay, with chefs from places like The Bombay Canteen and Masque and Naar counting themselves among the fortunate who've tasted it.Rita doesn’t believe in shortcuts. She cooks with memory, community, and soul. Not everyone gets to eat her food — but those who do never forget it.About the Meal -This meal is a celebration of everyday Khasi flavours — the kind found in family kitchens, bustling tea shops, and humble canteens across Shillong. Made with ingredients deeply rooted in the land, it features smoked pork slow-dried over a wood fire for up to 24 hours, giving it a rich, earthy depth. Nutty nei iong (black sesame) and fragrant nei leih (round sesame) lend texture and warmth, while sticky rice ties it all together — simple, grounding, essential.A spoonful of soh iiong, the tart local blackberries, adds a bright, unexpected note — just like the hills themselves. Eaten on quiet mornings and festive nights alike, this is a meal made from memory, meant to nourish and bring people together.MENU ✨ STARTERS 1.⁠ ⁠DOH THAD | Dried Smoke PorkDescription - A bold and fiery starter featuring pork that's been traditionally smoked over a wood fire for up to 24 hours, then crisp-fried with onions, capsicum and green chillies. Deeply savoury with a smoky kick, it’s the kind of dish that lingers — in memory and on the palate.2.⁠ ⁠MOMOS & SOHMYNKEN SAW | Pork Momos with Dried Red Chilly Chutney Description: A beloved tea-time bite in Khasi homes and hill-side stalls alike. Juicy pork, hand-minced, is wrapped in delicate dough and steamed to perfection. They're served with a fiery dried red chilli chutney — earthy, smoky, and just the right kind of heat to cut through the Shillong mist. ✨ MAINS 1.⁠ ⁠DOH SYIAR SHET KYLLA | Chicken curry and rice Description: A wholesome Khasi-style chicken curry, slow-cooked with potatoes and local spices and served with steamed rice. Accompaniments 1.⁠ ⁠TUNGTAP CHUTNEY | Dried fish chutney 2.⁠ ⁠⁠NEPALI CHUTNEY | Cold chickpea with Chayote Squash chutney2.⁠ ⁠JA STEM WITH DOH NEI IIONG | Rice cooked in Pork Broth with Black Sesame PorkDescription - Rice simmered in rich pork broth, paired with tender pork cooked in nutty black sesame; a soulful Khasi dish layered with depth, smoke, and tradition.Accompaniments 1.⁠ ⁠SOH SAW | Charred Tomato Chutney 2.⁠ ⁠DOH KHLIEH | Cold pork salad ✨ DESSERTJA SHULIA with SOH IIONG | Sticky rice, black berry jam and icecream Accompaniment SHA SAW | Khasi Black tea Notes1.⁠ ⁠This meal cannot accommodate any allergies or vegan/vegetarians.2.⁠ ⁠All courses contain pork and chicken.﻿Terms & Conditions:Please arrive punctually.Late arrivals may miss the first few courses.Booking Fee are non-refundable under all circumstances once booked.Tickets are transferrable to a third party.No shows/ cancellations will not be refunded, but you can reschedule your booking for within the week 48hrs before your slot is due.Alcohol will not be served to guests under the age of 21No liability or claims that may arise due to the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.The booking fee total includes the online transaction fee.Parking at the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Valet is available.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. She blends genres in a way that’s both uplifting and transformative. Her soundscapes are designed to move your soul and touch your spirit.Mahaa is our homegrown talent at Ecstatic World, and we are happy to have her as our resident musical guide with Ecstatic Dance Bengaluru.★ ADDITIONAL INFO- We maintain our personal boundaries with the namaste sign. - Respect the space and one another.- Move however you wish. - If you are coming with a child, kindly tend to them wholeheartedly so as to maintain the quietness of the space during the opening and closing circle. - Dress comfortable. -Kindly take care of personal hygiene before joining the session. -Avoid wearing strong smelling perfumes / synthetic fragrances.-Maximum capacity 100 per session. - Please kindly note that upon purchasing a ticket, ED Bengaluru team and management are not liable for any injury that may incur at the session. name: Creative Writing Workshop
description: This is a personalized, one-on-one writing workshop designed for those who want to reconnect with their writing in a focused, supportive space. The workshop is structured in three parts:Part 1: Prompt-Based Self-Reflection: We`ll begin with a guided reflection exercise using carefully chosen prompts. This part helps you explore personal thoughts, emotions, and experiences through writing—an excellent practice for journaling, memoir, or emotional clarity.Part 2: Creative Fiction Exercise: In the second half, you`ll be given an on-the-spot creative writing prompt to develop a short fictional piece. This encourages spontaneity, imagination, and narrative flow.Part 3: Understanding Yourself Better Using The 2 Writing ExercisesWe conclude by collecting our thoughts and discussing what you have learnt about yourself and about each other through our pieces in the workshop. You can write in any language you`re comfortable with. This format allows for flexible pacing, open conversation, and tailored feedback (if desired).Whether you`re looking to jumpstart your writing practice, process personal experiences, or simply enjoy a quiet hours of creativity, this one-on-one session is designed to meet you where you are—no pressure, just honest expression and guided structure.About the host : Swathi is a Berlin based writer who writes short fiction in different genres. She conducts creative writing workshops that help people process various emotions through self reflection pieces and overcome writer’s block by building a fictional world in a limited time. You can follow her on Instagram @swathispeaks or read her work on Medium.

name: Hello, “Thirsty Crow”! - at Sabha, BLR
description: Hello, Thirsty Crow!Puppet Show, Art Session and some Fun-Time! For Children aged 2-6 Years (and anyone who loves puppetry) 📍 Venue: Sabha, Kamaraj Road, Shivajinagar, BLR📅 Date: Sunday, July 13th, 2025⏰ Time: 11:00 AM to 12:30 PM🎟️ Tickets — pre-registration is a must!About The SessionWatch a modern take on the classic Panchatantra Story, “The Thirsty Crow” – with a handmade puppet! In a mini-theatrical setting, the imagination goes on a ride with songs, edutainment and a moral for a lifetime! Discover the magic of puppet-making as you dive into the creative process and learn how to bring your puppet to life!Meet The PuppeteerArt. Story. Repeat!Seeming like a traditional Virtual Reality (VR), Aditi is amused by this loop - Art creates a character and the Story is your imagination - endless possibilities!Starting her career as a UX/UI/Graphic Design IT professional in Bengaluru, she now pursues her childhood passion of bead art and puppetry - band of beads.About The VenueSabha is imagined as a cultural space housed in a meticulously restored 160-year-old CVS Sabha school, part of the RBANM's Educational Charities legacy. Envisioned as a hub for the arts, ideas, and community, Sabha is a place where heritage meets contemporary expression.

name: Oota & Aata: Edition 2
description: 'Travel back in time to peaceful simple evenings with friends & family' 'It was a really fun and engaging event. The hosts were attentive and the food was great.'Oota & Aata is an intimate, hyper-local event series that invites people to pause, gather, and play like we used to — back in the day.A curated experience set in Sabha inspired by balmy Bangalore’s late afternoons, games your ajji loved paired with comforting tea-time snacks inviting a slower kind of joy.Oota & Aata Edition 2Oota & Aata invites you to explore a range of traditional board games that may stir up a childhood memory or pique your curiosity to learn something new!Recreate the memory of a childhood home where slow weekend evenings were spent in playful exploration with loved ones, as you choose from one of the games like Alaguli Mane/Pallanguzhi, Pagade, Aadu Huli/ Tiger & Goat to explore.The event will also feature snack platters inspired by authentic South Indian tea-time snacks like vadais, Mangalore buns, kuzhipaniyarams and ambient music to elevate the experience. Gather your game-night crew, a friend or come solo for an evening of playful (could get competitive) fun and discovery!About SabhaSabha is imagined as a cultural space housed in a meticulously restored 160-year-old CVS Sabha school, part of the RBANM's Educational Charities legacy. Envisioned as a hub for the arts, ideas, and community, Sabha is a place where heritage meets contemporary expression.About Roll The DiceRoll The Dice is dedicated to reinventing the experience of playing traditional Indian board games. These games are most enjoyable and beneficial when played by people across generations, offering memory boosts, sharper thinking, relaxation, and improved cognitive skills.Please note - Event is only for ages 5+. Ticket is mandatory for all ages.

name: Folding Ninjas - Origami Club with Roligami
description: Not every gathering needs to be a formal workshop! Our Casual Fold & Connect Nights are all about relaxed creativity, sharing, and building community through Origami. Whether you’re seeking a new hobby, a meditative practice, or a creative outlet, the Folding Ninjas welcomes you! No prior experience is necessary—just bring your curiosity and enthusiasm.Absolute Beginners: We’ll help you get started with some easy folds!Intermediate Folders: Opportunity to refine techniques and learn and seek help from fellow foldersAdvanced Practitioners: Space to experiment, teach others, and push creative boundariesMeet-Up Structure5:00 PM - 5:30 PM: Welcome and Warm-UpCheck-In: Grab your name tag and settle inIce-Breaker Activity: A quick origami-related game or quick fold to get everyone engagedSkill Level Check-In: Beginners are paired with experienced folders for personalized guidance5:30 PM - 6:30 PM: Free-Form FoldingNo Structured Instructions but beginners will be provided with guidanceBring your own projects or start something newCollaborative and spontaneous foldingFree exchange of techniques and ideas6:30 PM - 7:00 PM: Show and ShareMembers showcase their completed projectsConstructive feedback and celebration of individual achievementsInformal networking and social timeWhat to BringBeginners: Nothing! We provide all materialsExperienced Folders:Your own specialty papers (optional)Any unique tools or templates you’d like to shareCompleted projects for show and tellSnacks to share (optional)Materials ProvidedVariety of origami papersInstructional guidesBasic tools (rulers, pencil, paper cutter, glue)About Your Instructor:Roli Agrawal, fondly known as roligami, is a multi-disciplinary designer and passionate craft enthusiast. Inspired by her love for Japanese culture, she has been exploring and teaching origami for over a decade. Roli’s workshops are a celebration of creativity, and her delightful creations are showcased on Instagram @roligami.Join us and add a handmade touch to your holiday cheer!

name: Maestro Impro™️ by Improv Lore
description: Maestro Impro™️ is a beloved world-famous competitive elimination-style improv format that pits twelve brave improvisers against each other. They’ll take on scenes, games, and challenges from the audience to build never-before seen/heard stories.After each round, the audience gets to vote improvisers out until just one remains to claim all the improv glory and be crowned the Maestro for the month!Who are Improv Lore?We are Bangalore-based community-theatre troupe, works towards spreading the art of spontaneous storytelling & unscripted stagecraft, and rekindling the joy of being playful & whimsical. We meet on Wednesdays for Jams, and on weekends for workshops.You can follow us on Instagram at @improvlore and join our WhatsApp community.

name: The Analog Club
description: Step back in time at The Analog Club, an event series by the Studio by Copper + Cloves.Imagine walking into a busy cafe and seeing not a single phone, no-one taking selfies and no one around you scrolling. Disconnect from devices for 3 hours of unplugged experience—we'll have books, board games, music, crochet, and of course, food! But this isn't about structured activities or organised fun, just genuine connection and relaxation. The event will be fluid- you can dip into activities if you want, or you can just chat to new people or graze at our high tea counter!Meet new friends, sketch, or read a book in quiet solitude (without being surrounded by people lost in their phones).We will not be doing social media on our phones at the event, we will only take photos with a camera.Embrace the analog experience, slow down, and reconnect in this crazy digital age! **Strictly no devices (no laptops, ipads, and you will be asked to keep your phone in a basket or in your bag- not in your pocket and no where on a table. E-books are allowed)**Tickets are for entry, all games and art supplies, and unlimited high tea from our renowned deli counter. Do not purchase a ticket if you are unwilling to surrender your devices for 3 hours.

name: Death of a Cult Leader - A Murder Mystery Game
description: 25 suspects. 1 Culprit. 1 Murder. Death of a Cult Leader is Varun Gwalani’s latest jaw-dropping murder mystery game — and you’re invited to solve it! This unique murder mystery experience involves:A thrilling theatre-of-the-mind style game with character sheets and maps Crime scenes where you discover, decode, and deduce the true nature of the case you’ve been asked to solve An endless number of clues and methods, but only one murderer👤Gather your wits, trust no one, and prepare for an unforgettable night. Ready to step into the dark? About the Author:Varun Gwalani is the creator and moderator of popular murder-mystery games that he’s successfully conducted across the country for over 500 participants. He’s also the author of seven novels: Believe, The First Storyteller, The Story Circle, The Novel Year, Who Saves the Hero?, The Only Way Out is Death and A Deadly Faith. Each book is a different genre, including a murder-mystery thriller.In addition to being an author, Varun has been a teacher of creative writing and English for several years now. He’s an advocate for mental health awareness, having given a TEDx talk and written several articles on Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder.

name: Barrel Beats – World Music Day at Pour Room
description: This World Music Day, let the world pour into your glass.June 21st isn’t just another date on the calendar — it’s World Music Day, and we’re turning up the volume at Pour Room by Fratelli with Barrel Beats: a celebration where global music meets gourmet indulgence.🎶 From lofi and mellow beats by Sakré to groovy house and disco sets by Double S, the night is set to flow with sound that matches the rhythm of every pour.🔥 Chef Upmanyu is taking open-flame cooking to the next level on Weber grills, serving up live barbeques that are smoky, bold, and unforgettable.🍫 BAR Chocolates brings the sweet crescendo with handcrafted desserts available to try at the venue, along with a selection of their signature chocolates for sale.💨 Pair that with smooth draws from Cigar Conexion, and you’ve got a night that plays on all five senses.🍷 All perfectly tuned to the notes of Fratelli’s finest wines — each pour echoing the craftsmanship and soul of the vineyard.Entry: ₹999 (fully redeemable on wine only) This World Music Day, celebrate more than just sound — celebrate taste, texture, and tempo. Only at Barrel Beats.

name: Aerial Rope Workshop
description: Aerial Rope workshop Not sure how to level up your aerial game?  There's a portal that's opened up at Bangalore Creative Circus which might just give you a peek into a whole new universe. Jump through to access the world of dynamic aerial rope with Ravi from Omaggio Performing Company. Portal is open only till slots last so quick, book your slot! It's time to learn to fly and explode in a parallel universe! Don't miss this opportunity! See you in the other universe!About the facilitator - This monkey man, also known as Ravi from Omaggio Performing Company is a devil in disguise. Be warned because dynamic rope is only one of his superpowers. Contemporary dance, Bboying, aerial straps, photography, sarcasm are a few of the others. He might appear calm and well mannered on the outside but on the inside he's a mischievous lil imp who is always out there to laugh, learn and poke fun at you! You have been warned!

name: Wiggleroom Popups (Series 2) : Analog Jam
description: Calling all synth lovers! Whether you're rolling with vintage hardware, fancy digital rigs, DAWs or Eurorack—it’s time to bring your gear and groove together. Join our Synth Petting Zoo + Jam: a laid-back meetup to swap patches, sync up your clocks (MIDI/CV), and improvise with a crew that speaks your sound language.We’ll start with a casual intro—share your setup and the sonic mood you’re tuning in from—then jump into free-flowing jams. Bring your own cables and let’s respect each other’s space: leave room in the frequency spectrum, watch your volume, and follow simple non‑verbal cues like nods or hand raises to shift the vibe. Our goal? No solo shows—just collective music, curious experimentation, and good conversation

name: Unlocking Purpose: A Midlife Enquiry
description: A soul-led workshop to explore questions of purpose, potential, and quiet knowing.What if clarity doesn’t come from fixing—but from listening?Unlocking Purpose is a 3-hour reflective workshop with mystic and life coach Veena Sethuraman, designed to help you reconnect with your inner compass—not as a crisis, but as a calling.Midlife can stir questions that don’t always have immediate answers:Why doesn’t success feel fulfilling?What is my purpose now?Where is my energy trying to flow?This workshop offers a gentle space to sit with those questions, not rush to solve them.Through a blend of group dialogue, quiet inquiry, and collective wisdom, we will explore:• What “purpose” really means to you now• The difference between potential you’ve expressed—and the parts still waiting• How to meet yourself without judgment, pressure, or old scriptsThis is not therapy.It’s not coaching.It’s a space to pause, listen, and gather your own truths in good company.What You’ll Experience·      Honest, guided conversation led by Veena Sethuraman·      Group sharing that honours vulnerability and nuance·      Reflection prompts to gently unlock stuck energy·      A space to be seen and heard—as you are·      Light refreshments in a calm, welcoming environmentMeet Your Facilitator: Veena SethuramanVeena is a Mystic, Life Coach, and TEDx speaker known for her grounded yet deeply spiritual approach to life transitions. She is the founder of Payanam, a space for meaning-making through inquiry. As a queer voice in the mental health space and author of A Pinch of Hope in a Bowl of Life, Veena offers her work as a quiet rebellion against performative living.

name: Alkmy - Malt & Meat
description: Our next pop-up is six-course tribute to old Bangalore’s naati cuisine -curated by Chef Kalyan, paired with Indian single malts by Paul John. This is a slow-cooked telling of a city’s past, where Tamil, Maratha, and Andhra influences simmer together in Old Bangalore’s ‘pete’ neighbourhoods to create something rich, fiery, and unforgettable.MENU:SALTBannur Lamb RibletsSalt cured Bannur lamb riblets confit cooked, paired with Paul John NirvanaPEPPERBannur Lamb OrgansLiver, heart, kidney & spleen of Bannur lamb sautéed with freshly ground black pepper, paired with Paul John MadeiraKOTHMIRIBannur Lamb ShoulderTender chunks of Bannur lamb shoulder sautéed in different forms of heirloom coriander, paired with Paul John PortGREEN CHILLIChilli Bannur Mutton, Akki RotiTender chunks of Bannur lamb leg, slow cooked with locally grown green chilliesRED CHILLIBannur Mutton Chops Fry, Mini DosaFatty & tender Bannur lamb chops slow cooked with a blend of homemade spices, paired with Paul John BrillianceMINTBannur Mutton Palav, RaithaExotic Old Bangalore style palav cooked with mint-based masala & coconut milkJAGGERYPheniOld Bangalore’s favourite dessert served traditionally, paired with Paul John Pedro Ximénez﻿Terms & Conditions:Please arrive punctually.Late arrivals may miss the first few courses.Booking Fee are non-refundable under all circumstances once booked.Tickets are transferrable to a third party.No shows/ cancellations will not be refunded, but you can reschedule your booking for within the week 48hrs before your slot is due.Alcohol will not be served to guests under the age of 21No liability or claims that may arise due to the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.The booking fee total includes the online transaction fee.Parking at the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Valet is available.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. In case you do not wish to be featured, let our team know.
